2. Anyone But You (1996) - This movie stars Ash Cook and James Nesbitt. The plot of the movie revolves around two strangers named Bea and Ben' who are meeting each other for the first time at a party. They quickly realize that they have an amazing chemistry between them, which makes their relationship very intense. However, as they spend more time together, they also begin to realize that there are certain things that they cannot share with each other. This realization leads them to eventually decide to end their relationship, but only after trying hard and really wanting to keep it going for a little longer.

conversation.text: Based on your preferences, I would recommend "Pride and Prejudice" by Jane Austen. This classic romance novel follows the romantic journey of Elizabeth Bennet, a clever and independent young woman from a wealthy family in England. In this story, Elizabeth meets Mr. Darcy, a rich and proud young man from a noble family in England. At first, Elizabeth and Mr. Darcy have no feelings towards each other. However, through various events and encounters, Elizabeth and Mr. Darcy gradually develop mutual feelings and admiration for each other. As the romantic journey of Elizabeth and Mr. Darcy continues to unfold, they gradually come to realize that they are truly meant to be together as a couple in love with each other.
